column5: Hi- Does anyone know how long the gun registration forms are good for when hunting in canada(the triplicate forms you fill out/sign in front of the customs officer)? We are headed back to Sask. the middle of October, but we went late Oct. last year. Was wondering if the forms are still good since it will be less than a year since we were up there (won't have to refill forms and pay the money again?) Any info is appreciated.

last time I went in with multiple rifles was the fall of 2004, at that time the permit was good for 1 year, so you should be good to go as long as the permit does not expire while you are in country. A quick call should confirm. I remember Canadian customs specifically telling me to keep my paper work as it was good for a year and could be used reapeatedly during that time frame. good luck GF
Pretty sure they changed it to 60 days and dropped to approx. $30. They want to keep us on our toes!! Good luck-Dennis
Just took a shotgun across this summer and permit was only good for 60 days. $25-30 was cost of permit.
Thanks for the info. Looks like we'll have to fill out the paperwork again and pay our money...oh well...well worth it for the experience!
They are correct they are only good for 60 days now.
